title: Help please with 2 font styles
content:
Hi, I'm new here and have been asked to use the following 2 fonts for some designs, I'm struggling to find them!

I think one is similar to VAG but the S and Y are different.

Any help greatly appreciated.

thanks  
Dave

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120505163019im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CMD_5917.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120505163019im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SMD_6588.gif)
author: Mcrdave

comments.content:
The other one is Rotis Semi Serif Black Schoolbook with the alternate Venetian ‘e’.

No, seriously: this looks rather like an unbalanced homebrew mix of a number of different typefaces. Some characters/terminals suggest it might have started out with Rotis in mind once, cf. its [Semi Serif Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20120505163019/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/rotis_semi_serif_by_adobe_std_65_bold/&sample_text=Consolidatemydebt.co.uk) (there is no Rotis Black, and of course no ‘Schoolbook’ style with single-storey ‘a’ either).

For a lusty semi-serif, have a look at [Areplos](http://web.archive.org/web/20120505163019/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/typefaces-45-areplos-text-pro-bold) by [Jan Solpera](http://web.archive.org/web/20120505163019/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jan%20Solpera).

Wow, thankyou so much!

The help on the Consolidate font was particularly fantastic! I knew it must have started with a fairly commn font and of course Rotis fits the bill perfectly.

thanks again for the speedy response.

Dave
If you have to use it: It is [Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20120505163019/http:/www.dafont.com/serif.font?nb_ppp=50&af=on&text=Consolidatemydebt) by Jürgen Geiger.

Even better!!!!!

Thanks soooooo much.

I owe you one!

Dave
Wow, impressive! (your sleuthing, not that freebie ;-))
Thanks, Florian, but that’s not really impressive. I just gathered some fonts at dafont which have »borrowed« some details from Rotis. Serif was one of the few.
